title: `name` and `value` attributes from buttons in forms are not available in `form data` when using `use:enhance`

labels.name: forms
labels.description: Stuff relating to forms and form actions

body:
### Describe the bug

When using the `use:enhance` action on forms, the `name` and `value` attributes provided on buttons are not submitted with the `form data` on form submission and are therefore not available in the `form data` in the action on the server. 

Without using the `use:enhance` action the buttons' `name` and `value` attributes are available in the action on the server.

It does not matter if using the `default` or a named action.

### Example
In this example there is no "button_name":"some_value" key-value pair available in the `form data`.
```javascript
<form method="post" use:enhance>
  <!-- other form elements-->
  <button
    type="submit"
    name="button_name"
    value="some_value">Submit</button
  >
</form>
```

I am not sure if this is intended behavior, I am doing some thing wrong or if this is a bug. 

I have searched through the other issues and discussions but could not find anything related. 

### Reproduction

[Reproduction](https://github.com/philip-weber/sveltekit-form-enhance-no-button-value)

1. Run `npm install`
2. Run `npm run dev`
3. Navigate to [/form-with-enhance](http://localhost:5173/form-with-enhance) and click the submit button.
4. You will see only the name/value from the input field below the form or in the server console.
   ```
   {
     "input_value": "input_form_value"
   }
   ```
5. Navigate to [/form-without-enhance](http://localhost:5173/form-without-enhance) and click the submit button.
6. You will see both the name/value from the input field and the name/value from the button below the form or in the server console.
   ```
   {
     "input_value": "input_form_value",
     "button_value": "submit_button_form_value"
   }
   ```

### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

Regarding MDN [Element/button#attr-value](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/button#attr-value) a button can have a `value` attribute which should be submitted with the `form data`.

### Workarounds
- For some use cases one can use a hidden field with the value inside the form instead of sending the value with the button
- For other use cases one needs to create multiple forms (with hidden fields) instead of one form with multiple buttons
